channel.title: nlin.SI updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: nlin.SI updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Low-dimensional tori in Calogero-Moser-Sutherland systems
item.description: arXiv:2506.16610v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We give an explicit description of low-dimensional Liouville tori in Calogero-Moser-Sutherland systems.
item.dc:creator: Andrii Liashyk, Guorui Ma, Nicolai Reshetikhin, Ivan Sechin

item.title: Integrable 3-Site, Tilted, Extended Bose-Hubbard Model with Nearest-Neighbour Interactions
item.description: arXiv:2506.21789v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: Extended Bose-Hubbard models have been employed in the study of cold-atom systems with dipolar interactions. It is shown that, for a certain choice of the coupling parameters, there exists an integrable extended 3-site Bose-Hubbard model with nearest-neighbour interactions. A Bethe ansatz procedure is developed to obtain expressions for the energy spectrum and eigenstates.
item.dc:creator: Jon Links

item.title: A $\mathcal C^\infty$-structure-based approach to traveling wave solutions of the gKdV equation
item.description: arXiv:2507.07112v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: A novel geometric method is applied to the problem of describing traveling wave solutions of the generalized Korteweg--de Vries (gKdV) equation in the form $$ u_t + u_{xxx} + a(u)u_x = 0, $$ where $a(u)$ is a smooth function characterizing the nonlinearity. Using the traveling wave ansatz, the gKdV equation reduces to an ordinary differential equation (ODE), which we analyze via the $\mathcal{C}^\infty$-structure-based method, a geometric framework involving sequences of involutive distributions and Pfaffian equations. Starting with the symmetry $\partial_z$, we construct a $\mathcal{C}^\infty$-structure for the ODE and apply the stepwise integration algorithm to obtain an implicit general solution. Then we derive explicit solutions for specific forms of $a(u)$, including the modified KdV and Schamel--KdV equations, as well as power-law nonlinearities.
item.dc:creator: Antonio J. Pan-Collantes
